Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pinto \Pin"to\, a. [Sp., painted.] Lit., painted; hence, piebald; mottled; pied. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pinto \Pin"to\, n. Any pied animal; esp., a pied or ``painted'' horse. [Webster 1913 Suppl.]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pintos \Pin"tos\, n. pl.; sing. {Pinto}. [Sp., painted, mottled.] (Eyhnol.) A mountain tribe of Mexican Indians living near Acapulco. They are remarkable for having the dark skin of the face irregularly spotted with white. Called also {speckled Indians}. [1913 Webster]
pinto n : a spotted or calico horse or pony
